definitions.definition: Pertaining to, or carried out by means of, a telescope .
Seen by means of a telescope; only visible through a telescope.
Capable of seeing distant objects ; far-seeing.
Able to be extended or retracted by the use of parts that slide over one another.
Referring to parts being extended or retracted along coinciding axes (with or without direct contact between the parts).

main_definition: Pertaining to, or carried out by means of, a telescope . [from 17th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( chiefly astronomy ) Seen by means of a telescope; only visible through a telescope. [from 17th c.]
Capable of seeing distant objects ; far-seeing. [from 18th c.]
Able to be extended or retracted by the use of parts that slide over one another. [from 19th c.]
Referring to parts being extended or retracted along coinciding axes (with or without direct contact between the parts). [from 20th c.]
